programme.title: The Great Escaper
programme.desc: Former Royal Navy officer Bernie Jordan is happily settled with wife Rene at a care home. Unfortunately, he hasn't secured a place on the official British Royal Legion trip to France to the commemorate the 70th anniversary of the D-Day landings. Bernie needs to make the trip to Normandy for personal reasons, and with Rene's blessing, he sneaks off to pay his respects. Drama, starring Michael Caine and Glenda Jackson in her final film.

programme.title: Dunkirk
programme.desc: Allied soldiers from Belgium, the British Empire and France are surrounded by the German army, and face a tense wait for evacuation, during a fierce battle in northern France during the Second World War. Christopher Nolan's wartime drama, which he wrote, directed and produced, starring Kenneth Branagh, Tom Hardy, Mark Rylance and Fionn Whitehead.

programme.title: Birdy

Alan Parker's psychological drama, based on William Wharton's novel, with Matthew Modine, Nicolas Cage, John Harkins, Karen Young and Sandy Baron.

programme.title: Breakfast at Tiffany's
programme.desc: An aspiring writer falls for a seemingly happy-go-lucky woman living in the same apartment building, and is drawn to her unconventional lifestyle. However, he detects her quirky demeanour is masking a colourful past, while her mysterious visits to an imprisoned gangster have unexpected consequences. Romantic comedy drama based on Truman Capote's novel, with Audrey Hepburn, George Peppard, Mickey Rooney and Martin Balsam.

programme.title: The Integrity Of Joseph Chambers
programme.desc: An insurance salesman, hoping to prove his survivalist skills to his family, irresponsibly goes hunting alone. But he isn't prepared for what lies ahead. Writer/director Robert Machoian's drama, starring Clayne Crawford and Jordana Brewster.

programme.title: Whiplash
programme.desc: A talented young jazz drummer thinks all his dreams have come true when he lands a place at a prestigious music academy. However, the experience turns into a nightmare thanks to an uncompromising tutor, who will stop at nothing to make his students realise their potential - including physical and mental abuse. Drama, starring Miles Teller, Paul Reiser and an Oscar-winning JK Simmons.

programme.title: The Man with the Answers
programme.desc: A former diving champion and an eccentric student take an adventurous road trip of rediscovery. Romantic drama, starring Vasilis Magouliotis, Anton Weil and Stella Fyrogeni. In Greek, Italian, German and English.

programme.title: Phantom Thread
programme.desc: Celebrated British dressmaker Reynolds Woodcock falls in love with Alma, a shy but strong-willed waitress who refuses to conform to his meticulous way of living. Paul Thomas Anderson's Oscar-winning drama, starring Daniel Day-Lewis in his final role before retirement, alongside Vicky Krieps and Lesley Manville.

programme.title: Breakfast at Tiffany's

Romantic comedy drama based on Truman Capote's novel, with Audrey Hepburn, George Peppard, Mickey Rooney and Martin Balsam.

programme.title: And Justice for All
programme.desc: A crusading but struggling lawyer reluctantly defends a cold-hearted judge charged with rape. Already haunted by the fates of two previous clients, he becomes increasingly disillusioned with American legal procedure as the trial progresses. Courtroom drama, starring Al Pacino, Jack Warden, John Forsythe and Lee Strasberg.

programme.title: The Great Escaper

programme.title: Jackie
programme.desc: Following the assassination of her husband, President John F Kennedy, Jacqueline Kennedy battles with grief and trauma to regain her faith, console her children, and define JFK's legacy. Director Pablo Larrain's Bafta-winning drama, starring Natalie Portman, Peter Sarsgaard and Greta Gerwig. Mica Levi provided the Oscar-nominated score.

programme.title: Bob Marley: One Love
programme.desc: In 1976, Jamaica is dangerously divided across political lines and musician Bob Marley vows to quell the violence by performing at the Smile Jamaica Concert. Two days before the high-profile gig, gunmen break into the singer's home, shooting Bob, his wife Rita and manager Don Taylor. Everyone survives and Marley moves to London with his entourage to begin work on the LP Exodus under Island Records supremo Chris Blackwell. Biographical drama, starring Kingsley Ben-Adir, Lashana Lynch and James Norton.

programme.title: Whiplash
programme.desc: A talented young jazz drummer thinks all his dreams have come true when he lands a place at a prestigious music academy. However, the experience turns into a nightmare thanks to an uncompromising tutor, who will stop at nothing to make his students realise their potential - including physical and mental abuse. Drama, starring Miles Teller, Paul Reiser and an Oscar-winning JK Simmons.

programme.title: Phantom Thread
programme.desc: Celebrated British dressmaker Reynolds Woodcock falls in love with Alma, a shy but strong-willed waitress who refuses to conform to his meticulous way of living. Paul Thomas Anderson's Oscar-winning drama, starring Daniel Day-Lewis in his final role before retirement, alongside Vicky Krieps and Lesley Manville.

programme.title: And Justice for All
programme.desc: A crusading but struggling lawyer reluctantly defends a cold-hearted judge charged with rape. Already haunted by the fates of two previous clients, he becomes increasingly disillusioned with American legal procedure as the trial progresses. Courtroom drama, starring Al Pacino, Jack Warden, John Forsythe and Lee Strasberg.

programme.title: Calvary
programme.desc: A priest in a rural Irish village receives a confession from a man who vows to kill him in one week as punishment for the Catholic Church's history of child abuse. The cleric spends his last seven days trying to put his community's affairs in order, but finds himself surrounded by people who harbour resentments of their own against the Church. Drama, starring Brendan Gleeson, Chris O'Dowd, Kelly Reilly, Aidan Gillen and Dylan Moran.

programme.title: High Noon
programme.desc: A town marshal is torn between love and duty on his wedding day as he prepares for the arrival of a vengeful adversary on the midday train. Meanwhile, the townsfolk the marshal has so loyally protected are certain he will be killed in the confrontation and abandon him one by one to face his enemy alone. Western, starring Gary Cooper, Grace Kelly, Lloyd Bridges and Lee Van Cleef.(n)

programme.title: Out of Africa
programme.desc: Fact-based romantic drama based on the life of writer Karen Blixen, who, after relocating from Denmark to a farm in Nairobi for a marriage of convenience, embarked on a passionate and ill-fated love affair with an idealistic British adventurer. Starring Meryl Streep, Robert Redford, Michael Kitchen, Klaus Maria Brandauer and Leslie Phillips.(n)

programme.title: Golda
programme.desc: In October 1973, Israeli Prime Minister Golda Meir initially refuses to act on intelligence that suggests Egypt and Syria intend to launch a co-ordinated military offensive against Israel. Eventually the attacks begin, catching Minister of Defence Moshe Dayan off guard. Meir refuses to accept his resignation and a weakened Dayan leads the Israeli response, which requires Meir to request air support from US Secretary of State, Henry Kissinger. Biopic, starring Helen Mirren, Zed Josef and Liev Schreiber.(n)

programme.title: Jackie
programme.desc: Following the assassination of her husband, President John F Kennedy, Jacqueline Kennedy battles with grief and trauma to regain her faith, console her children, and define JFK's legacy. Director Pablo Larrain's Bafta-winning drama, starring Natalie Portman, Peter Sarsgaard and Greta Gerwig. Mica Levi provided the Oscar-nominated score.(n)

programme.title: Bob Marley: One Love
programme.desc: In 1976, Jamaica is dangerously divided across political lines and musician Bob Marley vows to quell the violence by performing at the Smile Jamaica Concert. Two days before the high-profile gig, gunmen break into the singer's home, shooting Bob, his wife Rita and manager Don Taylor. Everyone survives and Marley moves to London with his entourage to begin work on the LP Exodus under Island Records supremo Chris Blackwell. Biographical drama, starring Kingsley Ben-Adir, Lashana Lynch and James Norton.(n)

programme.title: Charlie Wilson's War
programme.desc: A US congressman gets embroiled in a secret mission to provide covert military support to rebels in Soviet-occupied Afghanistan. Before long, he finds unlikely allies in the shape of a womanising CIA agent, a Texan socialite and the president of Pakistan. Fact-based political drama set during the 1980s, starring Tom Hanks, Julia Roberts and Philip Seymour Hoffman.(n)

programme.title: Lee
programme.desc: American fashion model-turned-war photographer Lee Miller is determined to document the truth of the Nazi regime, and in spite of the odds stacked against female correspondents, she captures some of the most important images of the Second World War. Fact-based drama, starring Kate Winslet, Andy Samberg, Alexander Skarsgard and Marion Cotillard.(n)

programme.title: One Life
programme.desc: In the months leading up to the Second World War, a young London stockbroker attempts to rescue hundreds of predominantly Jewish children from Nazi-occupied Czechoslovakia. Fifty years later he comes to terms with the guilt and grief he carried with him for decades. Drama based on a true story, starring Anthony Hopkins, Lena Olin and Johnny Flynn.(n)

programme.desc: A priest in a rural Irish village receives a confession from a man who vows to kill him in one week as punishment for the Catholic Church's history of child abuse. The cleric spends his last seven days trying to put his community's affairs in order, but finds himself surrounded by people who harbour resentments of their own against the Church. programme.title: King Arthur: Legend Of The Sword
programme.desc: Charlie Hunnam stars as a roguish swordsman who discovers his birthright and takes on evil uncle Jude Law. Guy Ritchie directs.

programme.title: Ride On
programme.desc: A washed-up stuntman and his stunt horse become an overnight social media sensation when their real-life fight with debt collectors goes viral. Comedy starring Jackie Chan.

programme.title: The Cinema List: Epic Adventure
programme.desc: Embark on an epic adventure in this iteration of the Cinema List, from a globe-trotting affair in Madagascar 3: Europe's Most Wanted to Robin Williams' Neverland escapades in Hook.

programme.title: Under The Boardwalk
programme.desc: When a storm casts two crabs far from home, a new adventure awaits. Animated comedy with Keke Palmer and Michael Cera.

programme.title: Smallfoot
programme.desc: An epic journey ensues when a Yeti named Migo stumbles across a real human being - but is banished from his snowy home when no-one believes him. With Channing Tatum.

programme.title: Dr. Seuss' The Lorax
programme.desc: In the synthetic town of Thneedville, a besotted boy takes up a quest to find the last real tree on earth. Animation with the voice of Danny DeVito.

programme.title: Journey To The Center Of The Earth
programme.desc: Brendan Fraser stars as a professor who takes his nephew on a quest to find his missing brother. Action adaptation of the Jules Verne classic. Violence/flashing images.

programme.title: Harold and The Purple Crayon
programme.desc: Inside his book, Harold can bring anything to life with his magic crayon. But now he has entered the real world, he has a lot to learn.

programme.title: The Garfield Movie
programme.desc: After reuniting with his dad, Garfield and his doggy pal Odie are forced into a heist. With the voices of Chris Pratt and Samuel L Jackson.

programme.title: If
programme.desc: After discovering her special ability to see imaginary friends, a girl goes on a magical adventure to reconnect forgotten IFs with their kids.

programme.title: Barbie
programme.desc: When dark thoughts start infiltrating Margot Robbie's perfect life, she leaves Barbieland - with Ryan Gosling - and discovers the real world.

programme.title: Warcraft
programme.desc: Fantasy adventure about an army of orcs who use powerful dark magic to flee their dying world and invade a peaceful kingdom.

programme.title: King Arthur: Legend Of The Sword
programme.desc: Charlie Hunnam stars as a roguish swordsman who discovers his birthright and takes on evil uncle Jude Law. Guy Ritchie directs.

programme.title: The Brothers Grimm
programme.desc: Tall-tale tellers Matt Damon and Heath Ledger are 19th-century con artists caught up in a fairy tale nightmare. Fantasy adventure. Contains violence and strong language.

programme.title: A Tiger's Journey
programme.desc: After he frees a tiger cub from the clutches of poachers, a young boy takes the animal on a journey through the Himalayas to find refuge.

programme.title: 10 Lives
programme.desc: When Beckett the cat loses his ninth life, fate sets him on a journey of self-discovery. Animated comedy with Mo Gilligan. Sky Original.

programme.title: DC Super Hero Girls: Legends of Atlantis
programme.desc: When a powerful book is stolen Wonder Woman, Supergirl and the rest of the team head to Atlantis in pursuit of underwater thieves. Animation.

programme.title: Big Fat Liar
programme.desc: When master fibber Frankie Muniz has his essay swiped by movie producer Paul Giamatti, he goes to LA to clear his name and get revenge. Kids' comedy with Amanda Bynes.

programme.title: The Garfield Movie
programme.desc: After reuniting with his dad, Garfield and his doggy pal Odie are forced into a heist. With the voices of Chris Pratt and Samuel L Jackson.

programme.title: If
programme.desc: After discovering her special ability to see imaginary friends, a girl goes on a magical adventure to reconnect forgotten IFs with their kids.

programme.title: The Boss Baby
programme.desc: Animated comedy about a youngster concerned that his baby brother is actually a power-hungry tycoon sent to destroy his perfect family life.

programme.title: Barbie
programme.desc: When dark thoughts start infiltrating Margot Robbie's perfect life, she leaves Barbieland - with Ryan Gosling - and discovers the real world.

programme.title: Hook
programme.desc: When Captain Hook kidnaps his kids, an adult Peter Pan returns to Neverland to save them. Adventure starring Robin Williams. Flashing images.

programme.title: Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire

programme.title: The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey
programme.desc: The first part of Peter Jackson's fantasy adventure trilogy based on the book by JRR Tolkien, starring Martin Freeman and Ian McKellen. Encouraged by the wizard Gandalf, Bilbo Baggins leaves the comfort of his home in the Shire to join a band of dwarves in their quest to reclaim the Kingdom of Erebor from the dragon Smaug. It is a journey that will see the plucky hobbit encounter goblins, orcs and

programme.title: The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug
programme.desc: Fantasy adventure starring Martin Freeman and Ian McKellen. Bilbo Baggins marches on towards the Lonely Mountain flanked by Thorin and his band of dwarves. There he is destined to encounter the fire-breathing dragon Smaug, guardian of a precious, mystical stone that bestows great power on anyone who possesses it.

programme.title: The Hobbit: The Battle of the Five Armies
programme.desc: Fantasy adventure, the conclusion to Peter Jackson's trilogy, starring Martin Freeman and Ian McKellen. Bilbo and his dwarf friends are facing enemies on all sides. They will have to fight orcs, trolls and each other if they are to keep hold of their gold. Meanwhile, Gandalf faces an ancient evil.

programme.desc: Garrett McNamara is now the director of the World Surf League's Tow Surfing Challenge in NazarÃ©, but eight-month pregnant Nicole McNamara and their young children fall ill with COVID-19, complicating his preparations and the plans for the birth.

programme.title: 100-Foot Wave
programme.desc: The huge swells at NazarÃ© continue to challenge and confound the best surfers in the world, and several dramatic rescues take place close to the perilous rocks; at the Gigantes De NazarÃ© event, several wipeouts and close calls threaten lives.

programme.title: 100-Foot Wave
programme.desc: In the aftermath of his accident, C.J. Macias contemplates his relationship with big wave surfing, as does Andrew "Cotty" Cotton; Cotty places in the second WSL contest of the season, Tony Laureano finally gets the opportunity to compete.

programme.title: Six by Sondheim
programme.desc: Filmmaker James Lapine examines the life and career of Stephen Sondheim, Broadway composer and lyricist.

programme.title: Where the Wild Things Are

programme.title: Rio

programme.title: Classical Baby
programme.desc: A medley of music, art and dance for children.

programme.title: Classical Baby

programme.title: The Music in Me: A Family Special
programme.desc: Profiles of young musicians from different musical and cultural traditions.

programme.desc: The friends welcome a new baby to the family, explore different musical instruments, eat in a restaurant and experience the change of seasons.

programme.desc: Convinced that Superman (Henry Cavill) is now a threat to humanity, Batman (Ben Affleck) embarks on a personal vendetta to end his reign on Earth, while the conniving Lex Luthor (Jesse Eisenberg) launches his own crusade against the Man of Steel.

programme.title: Super/Man: The Christopher Reeve Story
programme.desc: Actor Christopher Reeve rises to stardom when he lands the role of Superman in the 1970s. When a horse-riding accident leaves him paralyzed in 1995, Reeve spends the rest of his life searching for a cure for spinal cord injuries.

programme.title: Superman
programme.desc: Jor-El (Marlon Brando) of Krypton sends his baby to Earth, where he grows up as Clark Kent (Christopher Reeve) and works at the Daily Planet.

programme.title: Justice League
programme.desc: Fueled by his restored faith in humanity and inspired by Superman's selfless act, Batman and his new ally Wonder Woman recruit Aquaman, Cyborg and the Flash to help them save the planet from a newly awakened enemy.

programme.title: Man of Steel
programme.desc: Though struggling with the ramifications of his extraordinary origin and abilities, young Clark Kent (Henry Cavill) must become a hero and save those he loves from a dire threat.

programme.title: Greenland
programme.desc: A family embarks on a perilous journey as a planet-killing comet hurtles toward Earth. As the countdown to the global apocalypse approaches zero, their incredible trek culminates in a desperate and last-minute flight to a possible safe haven.

programme.title: The Conjuring: The Devil Made Me Do It
programme.desc: Paranormal investigators Ed and Lorraine Warren take on one of the most sensational cases of their careers when a young murder suspect claims demonic possession as his defense.

programme.title: Beetlejuice Beetlejuice
programme.desc: Still haunted by Beetlejuice, Lydia's life gets turned upside down when her daughter discovers a portal to the afterlife. When someone says Beetlejuice's name three times, the mischievous demon returns to unleash his very own brand of mayhem.

programme.title: Godzilla x Kong: The New Empire
programme.desc: Godzilla and the almighty Kong face a colossal threat hidden deep within the planet, challenging their very existence and the survival of the human race.

programme.title: Aquaman and the Lost Kingdom
programme.desc: Black Manta wields the power of the mythic Black Trident to unleash an ancient and malevolent force. Hoping to end his reign of terror, Aquaman forges an unlikely alliance with his brother to protect their kingdom and save the world from destruction.

programme.title: Jupiter Ascending
programme.desc: A genetically engineered soldier (Channing Tatum) informs an ordinary woman (Mila Kunis) of her destiny as the next recipient of an extraordinary inheritance that could alter the balance of the cosmos.

programme.desc: A group of actors sets out to make an adult film in rural Texas under the noses of their reclusive hosts, but when the elderly couple catches their young guests in the act, the cast finds themselves in a desperate fight for their lives.

programme.desc: In 1770 the young daughter of a French countess develops a mutual attraction to the female artist commissioned to paint her wedding portrait.

programme.desc: Horrific events plague a teen when his parents send him to a Christian camp.

programme.desc: An overprotective businessman (Bryan Cranston) panics after learning that his daughter's (Zoey Deutch) wealthy but socially awkward boyfriend (James Franco) plans to ask for her hand in marriage.

programme.desc: A descendant (Michael Fassbender) of the mysterious secret society known as the Assassins uses his newfound knowledge and physical skills to battle the power-hungry Templar Order.

programme.desc: Ed and Lorraine Warren travel to North London to help a single mother raising four children alone in a house plagued by a supernatural spirit.

programme.title: Green Lantern
programme.desc: The Green Lanterns have little regard for humans, who have been unable to harness the powers of the ring each member wears. But Jordan, a test pilot, may be the corps' only hope when an enemy called Parallax threatens the universal balance of power.

programme.title: Bad Santa 2
programme.desc: Fueled by cheap whiskey and greed, a foulmouthed criminal (Billy Bob Thornton), his mean mother (Kathy Bates) and their angry sidekick (Tony Cox) conspire to bilk a Chicago charity on Christmas Eve.

programme.title: The Dark Money Game
programme.desc: When a political lobbyist is found shot to death, his apparent suicide highlights a bizarre turn in Ohio's largest public corruption case, uncovered by federal investigators that was nearly concealed by loose super PAC campaign financing rules.

programme.title: The Dark Money Game
programme.desc: Tracing the tangled history of campaign finance back to the creation of the Federal Election Commission (FEC) in 1975, the 2002 McCain-Feingold Campaign Finance Reform Bill, and the Citizens United decision of 2010.

programme.title: Fist Fight
programme.desc: Fired from his teaching job for losing his cool, a disgruntled man (Ice Cube) challenges the colleague (Charlie Day) who snitched on him to a fight after school.

programme.title: Hamlet 2
programme.desc: Outraged citizens try to pull the plug on a staging of a lighthearted musical sequel to Shakespeare's tragedy, which has been written by the high-school drama teacher (Steve Coogan).

programme.title: Blue Beetle

programme.title: Drinking Buddies
programme.desc: Although they're both dating other people, two co-workers (Olivia Wilde, Jake Johnson) hang out together in bars and try to ignore their mutual attraction.

programme.title: Jason Bourne
programme.desc: The CIA's most dangerous former operative is drawn out of hiding to uncover more explosive truths about his past.

programme.title: We Live in Time
programme.desc: A surprise encounter brings together a couple, changing the course of their lives. Challenged by the limits of time, they learn to cherish each moment of their decade-spanning and movingly rare love story.

programme.title: Bad Santa
programme.desc: Two criminals (Billy Bob Thornton, Tony Cox) disguise themselves as St. Nick and an elf to rob stores at Christmastime.

programme.desc: A gay teen tries to adjust to a new life after moving from Cambodia to America with his mother.
